name: Home movies, fiction and reality blurred
description: The accessibility and portability of cameras has had a big impact on how we see ourselves and the world. As camera technology continues to evolve, so do our ways of seeing, with the line between reality and fiction disappearing.

key_work.title: Film cameras
key_work.brief_description: The home-movie market took off after World War II. Enthusiasts across the world began to document their lives with a series of small, easy-to-use home-movie cameras that shot on 8mm and 16mm film, like the Bolex H16 camera.

start.title: Me at the Zoo
start.brief_description: Me at the zoo is the first video that was uploaded to YouTube. It was uploaded on April 23, 2005 at 20:27:12 PDT by the site’s co-founder Jawed Karim, with the username “jawed” and recorded by his high school friend Yakov Lapitsky. He created a YouTube account on the same day. - Wikipedia

end.title: The Blair Witch Project
end.brief_description: In October of 1994 three student filmmakers disappeared in the woods near Burkittsville, Maryland, while shooting a documentary. A year later their footage was found.

constellations_other.name: Home movies, fiction and reality blurred
constellations_other.description: The accessibility and portability of cameras has had a big impact on how we see ourselves and the world. As camera technology continues to evolve, so do our ways of seeing, with the line between reality and fiction disappearing.

constellations_other.name: Found footage and the first camcorder
constellations_other.description: Amateur filmmakers turned the camera on their own lives when camcorders like the Sony Betamovie BMC-100P came on the market. The style of footage filmed on camcorders has inspired many fictional films, particularly in the horror genre.

constellations_other.name: Making home movies
constellations_other.description: Home movies have inspired the form and plots of narrative cinema.

recommendations.quote: Not only did The Blair Witch Project scare up $248.6 million USD at the box office, it also created the first viral marketing campaign (which led many people to believe it was true) and ushered in the era of hand-held doco-style found footage horror films.

links.description: YouTube was the by-product of accessible and affordable video cameras, as well as the popularity of DIY video. Likewise, the low-fi, found film phenomenon was an unexpected side effect of the 90s amateur movie making equipment, exemplified by The Blair Witch Project.

start.title: Taxi
start.brief_description: A yellow cab is driving through the vibrant and colourful streets of Tehran. Very diverse passengers enter the taxi, each candidly expressing their views while being interviewed by the driver who is no one else but the director Jafar Panahi himself. His camera placed on the dashboard of his mobile film studio captures the spirit of Iranian society through this comedic and dramatic drive…

end.title: Searching
end.creator_credit: Timur Bekmambetov, Adam Sidman, Natalie Qasabian, Sev Ohanian and Emily Moran

video_links.name: SEARCHING - Official International Trailer - In Cinemas September 2018

end.brief_description: After David Kim’s 16-year-old daughter goes missing, a local investigation is opened and a detective is assigned to the case. But 37 hours later and without a single lead, David decides to search the one place no one has looked yet, where all secrets are kept today: his daughter’s laptop.

constellations_other.description: Cinema, smartphones and sensuality collide in this intriguing Constellation that takes a distinctly different path.

links.description: Searching uses footage filmed entirely from built-in computer cameras, screen captures and smart phones. Reflecting our times and lack of privacy left in the world dominated by cameras and digital platforms to share footage.

end.brief_description: It’s Christmas Eve in LA and Sin-Dee is back on the block. Hearing that her pimp boyfriend hasn’t been faithful while she was in jail, Sin-Dee and her best friend, Alexandra, embark on a mission to get to the bottom of the scandalous rumor.

constellations_other.name: A handheld aesthetic
constellations_other.description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.

links.description: Tangerine is short entirely on an iPhone 5s and captures the life of a transgender sex worker using the ‘home made’ look of the cinematography to communicate the harsh reality, as well as the energy, of life on the streets.
